title: Frobenius inner product
summary: In mathematics, the Frobenius inner product is a binary operation that takes two matrices and returns a scalar. It is often denoted ⟨ A , B ⟩ F {\displaystyle \langle \mathbf {A} ,\mathbf {B} \rangle _{\mathrm {F} }} . The operation is a component-wise inner product of two matrices as though they are vectors, and satisfies the axioms for an inner product. The two matrices must have the same dimension - same number of rows and columns, but are not restricted to be square matrices.
